meanings.definition: To make something old-fashioned or obsolete.
meanings.sent2: The new fashion trend outmodes last season's styles.
meanings.sent3: The vintage car outmodes the modern vehicles in charm.
meanings.sent4: Her innovative approach outmodes traditional methods.
meanings.sent5: The rapid advancement of technology outmodes everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To surpass in usefulness or popularity.
meanings.sent1: His creativity outmodes his competitors in the industry.
meanings.sent2: The new smartphone outmodes all other models on the market.
meanings.sent3: The talented singer outmodes the other performers with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent4: The bright student outmodes his classmates in academic achievements.
meanings.sent5: The delicious homemade pie outmodes store-bought desserts easily.
